FuncDef:
The info-center debugfile-name command configures a name for a specified debugging log file.
The undo info-center debugfile-name command deletes the name configured for the debugging log file.
By default, a debugging log file is named debug.log.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a debugging log file name.
The value must be a string of 1 to 16 characters, consisting of only letters and digits. It cannot be any existing log file name, such as log.log and debug.log.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a name for a specified debugging log file, run the info-center debugfile-name command. You can obtain the debugging log file as needed.
You can run the display logfile list command to view the path for storing debug log files.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
